item.title: Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires
item.description:
Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires

Thirty years after the Chernobyl disaster, firefighters remain on high alert to prevent radioactive forest fires. Originally published at - http://www.rferl.org/media/video/guarding-against-chernobyls-radioactive-forest-fires/27691519.html

item.description:
A Turning Point for China?

In this film, William Nee discusses what it's like doing human rights work in China today, and tells the story of Pu Zhiqiang, one of China's most famous fre...

item.title: Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square
item.description:
Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square

Performance artist Roman Roslovtsev returned to Red Square to stage his latest masked protest against Russian President Vladimir Putin and a law on public ga...

item.title: El Nino Could Cause Famine to Reoccur in Somalia
item.description:
El Nino Could Cause Famine to Reoccur in Somalia

A group of 23 nongovernmental organizations working in Somalia say the country is in danger of falling into famine, as it did in 2010, because of drought and food shortages. The groups known as the Somalia NGO Consortium released its statement Tuesday, saying the shortages are linked to the El Nino weather phenomenon, which has proven to be one of the worst on record.

item.title: After Delays, South Sudan Rebel Chief Set to Return to Juba
item.description:
After Delays, South Sudan Rebel Chief Set to Return to Juba

South Sudanese rebel leader Riek Machar is due to arrive in the capital Tuesday, after several cancellations that have held up the peace process aimed at ending the country's civil war. Dignitaries were gathered at the airport in Juba, waiting for Machar to return for the first time since war erupted in 2013.

item.title: Critics: North Korea Peace Proposal Worth Consideration
item.description:
Critics: North Korea Peace Proposal Worth Consideration

President Barack Obama's swift rejection of a North Korean proposal to suspend further nuclear tests was a bit surprising for a growing number of advocates who believe that international sanctions alone will not persuade the Kim Jong Un government to unilaterally disarm.

item.title: Analysts: Philippine Beheading for Money, Not Religion
item.description:
Analysts: Philippine Beheading for Money, Not Religion

An insurgency group-turned-kidnap for ransom gang has been highly active in the southern Philippines in recent weeks, with several abductions of foreign nationals and now the beheading of a Canadian hostage. In a joint statement released Tuesday, Philippine military and police vowed "no let-up" in their pursuit of members of the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG).

item.title: Yemeni Forces Take Control of Mukalla
item.description:
Yemeni Forces Take Control of Mukalla

Security officials in Yemen said they have retaken the southern city of Mukalla, a day after reports that Yemeni fighters killed more than 800 al-Qaida militants in a single offensive. Yemeni forces entered Mukalla late Monday after two days of heavy airstrikes on the coastal town that al-Qaida in the Arabian Peninsula has controlled for the past year.
